page.title: 05Landscove Farmers
page.content: At present the{farmers}pay Â£32 per year per acre for the land which they lease, and a negotiated rent for buildings. Entry to the European Economic Community has meant the introduction of many restrictions on production at every farm.The Ministry of Agriculture sends inspectors to make sure that the laws are obeyed.One such rule is that no farmer may sell or give away unpasteurized{milk}for consumption by anyone other than his own family. The{labourers}on the farm number from 1 to 6 usually in proportion to the size of the farmers family.They are paid a basic wage about Â£90 per week. The powerful{tractors}with all kinds of sophisticated add-ons can easily cope with all the farm work.
